properties.name: Foreign investors snapping up property and art triggers much arm-waving from the French
properties.description: Posted by Jgaynard 35, rue de RivoliThe crowd of foreign investors snapping up property and art has triggered much arm-waving from the French over what is condemned as \'a national car boot sale\'. Jason Burke reports from Paris.

properties.name: Galignani's Franco-American Bookstore on the rue de Rivoli
properties.description: Posted by Jgaynard37, avenue de l\'Opéra, ParisThis is my favourite bookstore in Paris. Staff who know books. I am always amazed at how up to date they are with recent American titles, especially in the field of politics. An added advantage is that the bookshop is right next to Angelina\'s, which serves the best hot chocolate in Paris.

properties.name: Good American Hamburgers and Brunch
properties.description: Posted by Jgaynard Paris 75001, France

properties.name: Home to Syre Consulting, the specialists in cross-cultural transitions management
properties.description: Posted by Jgaynard 8 rue Saint Augustin, 75002 Paris, FranceWe have been here since 1998. Not far from the old Louvre, the old National Library, the old Stock Exchange and the Old Opera. But we are totally in the Knowledge Economy.

properties.name: Louvre Museum
properties.description: Posted by Paiges "Now?" Langdon managed. "It\'s after midnight." "Am I correct that you were scheduled to meet with the curator of the Louvre this evening?" Langdon felt a sudden urge of uneasiness. He and the revered curator Jacques Sauniere had been slated to meet for drinks after Langdon\'s lecture tonight, but Sauniere had never shown up. "Yes. How did you know that?" "We found your name in his daily planner." "I trust nothing is wrong?" The agent gave dire sigh and slid a Polaroid snapshot through the narrow opening in the door. When Langdon saw the photo, his entire body went rigid. "This photo was taken less than an hour ago. Inside the Louvre." pg. 11 of The Da Vinci Code by Dan Brown, 2003 Louvre Museum. The main location of Dan Brown\'s novel and the subsequent movie.

properties.name: Rue de la Goutte D'Or
properties.description: Posted by YanpearceThis is the street around which most of the action in the novel takes place

properties.name: The Expiatory Chapel

properties.name: The Mesturet Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Jgaynard8 rue Saint Augustin, 75002 Paris, FranceRight on the corner of the Rue de Richelieu and the Rue Saint-Augustin, one of the friendliest wine bars in Paris. Ideal for a group of friends who want to taste wine between 5 pm and 7 pm from Monday to Friday.

properties.name: Top breaks for Mother's Day
properties.description: Posted by JgaynardNotre DameStuck for ideas to whisk mum off her weary feet? Paul Torpey rounds up his pick of the best Mother\'s Day treats at home and away.
